protocol.purpose: Evaluate PR code quality, emit structured findings through FAC, and set a SHA-bound decision.

forbidden_operations: NEVER run git commands that modify worktree state (git reset, git checkout, git clean, git stash, git rebase, git merge, git cherry-pick, git commit, git push, git pull, git fetch).
NEVER use direct gh or git commands for any purpose. All repository and GitHub interactions MUST go through apm2 fac review commands exclusively.
All interactions with the repository MUST be read-only.

invariants: "pr_number" MUST match the prepared PR number exactly.
SHA is auto-derived from prepared inputs — never pass --sha manually.
Deployment invariant: this CLI serves Anveio on the current VPS only; do NOT file compatibility findings that require broad enterprise/custom-remote support or GitHub-as-authority fallback.

references.purpose: Holonic model, truth/projection split, and verification-first behavior.
Global repository instructions.
Cross-cutting policy guardrails.
Fast triage procedure.
Invariant and contract mapping.
Complexity reduction checks.
Error handling expectations.
Public API compatibility and ergonomics.
Test sufficiency expectations.
Performance regressions and hotspots.
Dependency and build-surface scrutiny.
Severity calibration.
Finding statement quality.
Canonical PCAC/AJC integration pattern for authority-bearing handlers.
Primitive soundness invariants (type validity, initialization, alignment, data races).
Place model, move semantics, drop scopes, temporary lifetimes, pattern binding modes.
Ownership authority, interior mutability protocols, borrow-across-await hazards.
Variance and auto-trait observability; PhantomData and Pin contracts.
Coherence rules; trait bound SemVer impacts; auto-trait drift detection.
Five allocator invariants: UAF, double-free, alignment, overlap, drop discipline.
Panic safety, unwind discipline, structured logging, lint policy enforcement.
Repr contracts, layout stability, drop discipline, partial initialization.
Misuse-resistant APIs: visibility, construction validation, borrowed vs owned.
Use-after-realloc prevention, size math overflow, bounded stores, deterministic iteration.
UTF-8 validity, text units, grapheme policies, confusable prevention.
Tool selection per risk anchor: Miri, Loom, Proptest, Kani gating.
Performance contracts, benchmark methodology, code-size/monomorphization control.
Dark-code control, build matrix coverage, feature stability, fail-closed flags.
MSRV enforcement, edition migrations, deprecation strategies.
Macro hygiene, hidden unsafe prevention, build-time execution control.
FFI validity, ABI unwinding, ownership transfer, safe wrapper patterns.
Monotonic clocks, wall-clock hazards, distributed ordering, defensive duration handling.
APM2-specific: typed IDs, secret redaction, state machines, atomic writes, identity boundaries.
Phase-aware reasoning; macro expansion, dark code, drop/borrow checking semantics.
QCP risk escalation and proof-burden multiplier logic.

nodes.purpose: Discover FAC commands and internalize all reference material before execution.

steps.rule: Read every file listed in the references[] section IN FULL. Do not summarize, skip, or skim — details matter. Each reference contains invariants, contracts, checklists, and anti-patterns that are load-bearing for review accuracy. Incomplete internalization produces false negatives.
For each crate/module touched by the PR diff, read its AGENTS.md (if it exists) in full. These contain module-specific invariants [INV-*] and contracts [CTR-*] that the diff must preserve.

nodes.purpose: Materialize the PR review inputs from FAC.

steps.action: Set headRefOid = head_sha. Set reviewed_sha = headRefOid.

steps.if: diff_path is empty OR head_sha is empty
steps.message: STOP-NO-PREPARED-INPUTS: fac review prepare did not return required fields.

nodes.purpose: Collect quality standards and relevant module context.

steps.rule: Read AGENTS.md files adjacent to modules touched by the diff.
Read RFC/ticket/doc references linked from touched files when necessary for intent verification.

nodes.purpose: Evaluate correctness, maintainability, and test evidence.

lenses.focus: Behavioral regressions, hidden coupling, invalid assumptions.
Missing tests, weak assertions, absent negative cases.
Hot-path regressions, needless allocations, expensive loops.
Authority-bearing handlers follow canonical PCAC lifecycle (join -> revalidate -> consume -> effect) and prefer PrivilegedPcacInputBuilder over manual join-input construction.

nodes.purpose: Emit each finding as a structured record via FAC. Findings accumulate locally per PR/type/SHA.

steps.rule: Classify each issue found during analysis by severity: BLOCKER, MAJOR, MINOR, NIT. Each finding MUST include a summary, risk description, impact assessment, and code location.
Each finding includes path, impact, and required action.
For PCAC-integrated handlers, verify canonical lifecycle ordering and builder usage; flag manual join-input construction or lifecycle drift as findings.

For each finding, call: apm2 fac review finding --type code-quality --severity <BLOCKER|MAJOR|MINOR|NIT> --summary "<one-line summary>" --risk "<why this matters>" --impact "<consequences if unaddressed>" --location "<file:line or module>" --body "<detailed description and required action>" --json
steps.note: SHA is auto-derived from the current PR identity — do NOT pass --sha. Findings accumulate locally and are projected to GitHub when the verdict is set.

steps.rule: For prior-round findings that are now resolved, emit with --severity NIT and note the resolution in --body.

nodes.purpose: Write SHA-bound verdict for code-quality dimension. This also triggers concatenation of all accumulated findings into a single comment projected to GitHub (best effort).

then.run: apm2 fac review verdict set --dimension code-quality --verdict approve --reason "PASS for $head_sha" --json
apm2 fac review verdict set --dimension code-quality --verdict deny --reason "BLOCKER/MAJOR findings for $head_sha" --json

nodes.note: Verdict command removes prepared tmp review inputs by default. Use --keep-prepared-inputs only when debugging.
